title: Cynthia Ozick - Novels, Stories, and Essays (16 books)
description:
CYNTHIA OZICK (b. 1928) is an American short story writer, novelist, and essayist.  Her works explore the challenge of remaining Jewish in contemporary American life, the reconstruction of identity after immigration, trauma and movement from one class to another.  In addition to her award-winning fiction, Ozick is also an accomplished writer on politics, history, and literary criticism.

The novelist David Foster Wallace called Ozick one of the greatest living American writers.  She has been variously described as "the Athena of Americaâ€™s literary pantheon," the "Emily Dickinson of the Bronx," and "one of the most accomplished and graceful literary stylists of her time."

No serious reader should miss "The Shawl" (1980), a devastating vision of the Holocaust and the unfillable emptiness it left in the lives of those who passed through it.

I am especially indebted to @pharmakate for six of the PDFs in this collection, several of which have not been publicly posted before now.  Dear friend, we miss you.


The following books are in PDF and/or ePUB format as indicated:


                                 == FICTION ==

* Bloodshed and Three Novellas (Knopf, 1976) -- PDF

* Cannibal Galaxy, The (Dutton, 1984) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate)

* Collected Stories (Weidenfeld & Nicolson, 2006) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate)

* Dictation: A Quartet (Houghton Mifflin, 2008) -- ePUB

* Foreign Bodies (Atlantic, 2011) -- ePUB

* Heir to the Glimmering World (Houghton Mifflin, 2004) -- ePUB

* Messiah of Stockholm, The (Knopf, 1987 / Atlantic, 2013) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate) + ePUB

* Pagan Rabbi & Other Stories, The (Knopf, 1971) -- PDF

* Puttermesser Papers, The (Knopf, 1997 / Atlantic, 2014) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate) + ePUB

* Shawl, The (Vintage, 1990) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate)

* Trust (New American Library, 1966) -- PDF (courtesy of @pharmakate) + ePUB


                               == NON-FICTION ==

* Art of Fiction, No. 95 (Paris Review, Spring 1987).  Interview by Tom Teicholz. -- PDF

* Critics, Monsters, Fanatics, and Other Literary Essays (Houghton Mifflin, 2016) -- ePUB

* Din in the Head: Essays (Houghton Mifflin, 2006) -- ePUB

* Fame and Folly: Essays (Vintage, 1997) -- ePUB

* Quarrel and Quandary: Essays (Vintage, 2001) -- ePUB
